info.title: Honcho API
info.summary: The Identity Layer for the Agentic World
info.description: Honcho is a platform for giving agents user-centric memory and social cognition.

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

post.description:
Get a Workspace by ID.

If workspace_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT workspace_id).
Otherwise, it uses the workspace_id from the JWT.
Get all Workspaces

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

schema.description: Filtering and pagination options for the workspaces list
schema.title: Options

delete.description:
Delete a Workspace. This will permanently delete all sessions, peers, messages, and conclusions
associated with the workspace.

This action cannot be undone.

post.description:
Search messages in a Workspace using optional filters. Use `limit` to control the number of
results returned.

schema.title: Response Search Workspace V3 Workspaces  Workspace Id  Search Post

and/or session.

post.description:
Get a Peer by ID or create a new Peer with the given ID.

If peer_id is provided as a query parameter, it uses that (must match JWT workspace_id).
Otherwise, it uses the peer_id from the JWT.

put.description: Update a Peer's metadata and/or configuration.

post.description: Get all Sessions for a Peer

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

schema.description: Filtering options for the sessions list
schema.title: Options

post.description:
Get a curated subset of a Peer's Representation. A Representation is always a subset of the total
knowledge about the Peer. The subset can be scoped and filtered in various ways.


If a session_id is provided in the body, we get the Representation of the Peer scoped to that Session.
If a target is provided, we get the Representation of the target from the perspective of the Peer.
If no target is provided, we get the omniscient Honcho Representation of the Peer.

schema.description: Options for getting the peer representation

get.description:
Get a peer card for a specific peer relationship.

Returns the peer card that the observer peer has for the target peer if it exists.
If no target is specified, returns the observer's own peer card.

parameters.name: peer_id
parameters.description: ID of the observer peer

parameters.name: target

schema.description: Optional target peer to retrieve a card for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, returns the observer's own card
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: Optional target peer to retrieve a card for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, returns the observer's own card

put.description:
Set a peer card for a specific peer relationship.

Sets the peer card that the observer peer has for the target peer.
If no target is specified, sets the observer's own peer card.

parameters.name: peer_id
parameters.description: ID of the observer peer

parameters.name: target

schema.description: Optional target peer to set a card for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, sets the observer's own card
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: Optional target peer to set a card for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, sets the observer's own card

get.description:
Get context for a peer, including their representation and peer card.

This endpoint returns a curated subset of the representation and peer card for a peer.
If a target is specified, returns the context for the target from the
observer peer's perspective. If no target is specified, returns the
peer's own context (self-observation).

This is useful for getting all the context needed about a peer without
making multiple API calls.

parameters.name: peer_id
parameters.description: ID of the observer peer

parameters.name: target

schema.description: Optional target peer to get context for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, returns the observer's own context (self-observation)
schema.title: Target

parameters.description: Optional target peer to get context for, from the observer's perspective. If not provided, returns the observer's own context (self-observation)

parameters.name: search_query

schema.description: Optional query to curate the representation around semantic search results
schema.title: Search Query

parameters.description: Optional query to curate the representation around semantic search results

parameters.name: search_top_k

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Number of semantic-search-retrieved conclusions to include
schema.title: Search Top K

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Number of semantic-search-retrieved conclusions to include

parameters.name: search_max_distance

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum distance for semantically relevant conclusions
schema.title: Search Max Distance

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum distance for semantically relevant conclusions

parameters.name: include_most_frequent

schema.description: Whether to include the most frequent conclusions in the representation
schema.title: Include Most Frequent

parameters.description: Whether to include the most frequent conclusions in the representation

parameters.name: max_conclusions

schema.description: Maximum number of conclusions to include in the representation
schema.title: Max Conclusions

parameters.description: Maximum number of conclusions to include in the representation

post.description: Get all Sessions for a Workspace

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

schema.description: Filtering and pagination options for the sessions list
schema.title: Options

post.description:
Get a Session by ID or create a new Session with the given ID.

If Session ID is provided as a parameter, it verifies the Session is in the Workspace.
Otherwise, it uses the session_id from the JWT for verification.

put.description: Update a Session's metadata and/or configuration.

delete.description:
Delete a Session and all associated messages.

The Session is marked as inactive immediately and returns 202 Accepted. The actual
deletion of all related data happens asynchronously via the queue with retry support.

This action cannot be undone.

post.description: Clone a Session, optionally up to a specific message ID.

parameters.name: message_id

schema.description: Message ID to cut off the clone at
schema.title: Message Id

parameters.description: Message ID to cut off the clone at

post.description: Add Peers to a Session. If a Peer does not yet exist, it will be created automatically.

schema.description: List of peer IDs (with session-level configuration) to add to the session
schema.title: Peers

put.description:
Set the Peers in a Session. If a Peer does not yet exist, it will be created automatically.

This will fully replace the current set of Peers in the Session.

schema.description: List of peer IDs (with session-level configuration) to set for the session
schema.title: Peers

delete.description: Remove Peers by ID from a Session.

schema.description: List of peer IDs to remove from the session
schema.title: Peers

get.description: Get all Peers in a Session

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Page size

get.description: Get the configuration for a Peer in a Session.

put.description: Set the configuration for a Peer in a Session.

get.description:
Produce a context object from the Session. The caller provides an optional token limit which the entire context must fit into.
If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within configured max tokens). To do this, we allocate 40% of the token limit
to the summary, and 60% to recent messages -- as many as can fit. Note that the summary will usually take up less space than
this. If the caller does not want a summary, we allocate all the tokens to recent messages.

parameters.name: tokens

schema.description: Number of tokens to use for the context. Includes summary if set to true. Includes representation and peer card if they are included in the response. If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within 100000 tokens)
schema.title: Tokens

parameters.description: Number of tokens to use for the context. Includes summary if set to true. Includes representation and peer card if they are included in the response. If not provided, the context will be exhaustive (within 100000 tokens)

parameters.name: search_query

schema.description: A query string used to fetch semantically relevant conclusions
schema.title: Search Query

parameters.description: A query string used to fetch semantically relevant conclusions

parameters.name: summary

schema.description: Whether or not to include a summary *if* one is available for the session
schema.title: Summary

parameters.description: Whether or not to include a summary *if* one is available for the session

parameters.name: peer_target

schema.description: The target of the perspective. If given without `peer_perspective`, will get the Honcho-level representation and peer card for this peer. If given with `peer_perspective`, will get the representation and card for this peer *from the perspective of that peer*.
schema.title: Peer Target

parameters.description: The target of the perspective. If given without `peer_perspective`, will get the Honcho-level representation and peer card for this peer. If given with `peer_perspective`, will get the representation and card for this peer *from the perspective of that peer*.

parameters.name: peer_perspective

schema.description: A peer to get context for. If given, response will attempt to include representation and card from the perspective of that peer. Must be provided with `peer_target`.
schema.title: Peer Perspective

parameters.description: A peer to get context for. If given, response will attempt to include representation and card from the perspective of that peer. Must be provided with `peer_target`.

parameters.name: limit_to_session

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Whether to limit the representation to the session (as opposed to everything known about the target peer)
schema.title: Limit To Session

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Whether to limit the representation to the session (as opposed to everything known about the target peer)

parameters.name: search_top_k

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The number of semantic-search-retrieved conclusions to include in the representation
schema.title: Search Top K

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The number of semantic-search-retrieved conclusions to include in the representation

parameters.name: search_max_distance

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The maximum distance to search for semantically relevant conclusions
schema.title: Search Max Distance

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The maximum distance to search for semantically relevant conclusions

parameters.name: include_most_frequent

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Whether to include the most frequent conclusions in the representation
schema.title: Include Most Frequent

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Whether to include the most frequent conclusions in the representation

parameters.name: max_conclusions

schema.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The maximum number of conclusions to include in the representation
schema.title: Max Conclusions

parameters.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. The maximum number of conclusions to include in the representation

get.description:
Get available summaries for a Session.

Returns both short and long summaries if available, including metadata like
the message ID they cover up to, creation timestamp, and token count.

post.description:
Create one or more Conclusions.

Conclusions are logical certainties derived from interactions between Peers. They form the basis of a Peer's Representation.

schema.title: Response Create Conclusions V3 Workspaces  Workspace Id  Conclusions Post

MessageConfiguration.title: MessageConfiguration
MessageConfiguration.description:
The set of options that can be in a message DB-level configuration dictionary.

All fields are optional. Message-level configuration overrides all other configurations.

use.title: Use
use.description: Whether to use peer card related to this peer during reasoning process.

create.title: Create
create.description: Whether to generate peer card based on content.

peer_card.title: Peer Card
peer_card.description: The peer card content, or None if not found

peer_card.title: Peer Card
peer_card.description: The peer card content to set

target_id.title: Target Id
target_id.description: The ID of the target peer being observed

representation.title: Representation
representation.description: A curated subset of the representation of the target peer from the observer's perspective

peer_card.title: Peer Card
peer_card.description: The peer card for the target peer from the observer's perspective

PeerContext.title: PeerContext
PeerContext.description: Context for a peer, including representation and peer card.

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Optional session ID within which to scope the representation

target.title: Target
target.description: Optional peer ID to get the representation for, from the perspective of this peer

search_query.title: Search Query
search_query.description: Optional input to curate the representation around semantic search results

search_top_k.title: Search Top K
search_top_k.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Number of semantic-search-retrieved conclusions to include in the representation

search_max_distance.title: Search Max Distance
search_max_distance.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum distance to search for semantically relevant conclusions

include_most_frequent.title: Include Most Frequent
include_most_frequent.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Whether to include the most frequent conclusions in the representation

max_conclusions.title: Max Conclusions
max_conclusions.description: Only used if `search_query` is provided. Maximum number of conclusions to include in the representation

pending_work_units.title: Pending Work Units
pending_work_units.description: Work units waiting to be processed

sessions.title: Sessions
sessions.description: Per-session status when not filtered by session

custom_instructions.title: Custom Instructions
custom_instructions.description: TODO: currently unused. Custom instructions to use for the reasoning system on this workspace/session/message.

observed.title: Observed
observed.description: Observed peer name (defaults to observer if not specified)

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Session ID to scope the dream to if specified

peer_card.description: Configuration for peer card functionality. If reasoning is disabled, peer cards will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

dream.description: Configuration for dream functionality. If reasoning is disabled, dreams will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

SessionConfiguration.title: SessionConfiguration
SessionConfiguration.description:
The set of options that can be in a session DB-level configuration dictionary.

All fields are optional. Session-level configuration overrides workspace-level configuration, which overrides global configuration.

peer_representation.title: Peer Representation
peer_representation.description: A curated subset of a peer representation, if context is requested from a specific perspective

peer_card.title: Peer Card
peer_card.description: The peer card, if context is requested from a specific perspective

observe_me.title: Observe Me
observe_me.description: Whether Honcho will use reasoning to form a representation of this peer

observe_others.title: Observe Others
observe_others.description: Whether this peer should form a session-level theory-of-mind representation of other peers in the session

session_id.title: Session Id
session_id.description: Session ID if filtered by session

pending_work_units.title: Pending Work Units
pending_work_units.description: Work units waiting to be processed

SessionQueueStatus.title: SessionQueueStatus
SessionQueueStatus.description: Status for a specific session within the processing queue.

message_id.title: Message Id
message_id.description: The public ID of the message that this summary covers up to

summary_type.title: Summary Type
summary_type.description: The type of summary (short or long)

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: The timestamp of when the summary was created (ISO format)

token_count.title: Token Count
token_count.description: The number of tokens in the summary text

messages_per_short_summary.title: Messages Per Short Summary
messages_per_short_summary.description: Number of messages per short summary. Must be positive, greater than or equal to 10, and less than messages_per_long_summary.

messages_per_long_summary.title: Messages Per Long Summary
messages_per_long_summary.description: Number of messages per long summary. Must be positive, greater than or equal to 20, and greater than messages_per_short_summary.

peer_card.description: Configuration for peer card functionality. If reasoning is disabled, peer cards will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

dream.description: Configuration for dream functionality. If reasoning is disabled, dreams will also be disabled and these settings will be ignored.

WorkspaceConfiguration.title: WorkspaceConfiguration
WorkspaceConfiguration.description:
The set of options that can be in a workspace DB-level configuration dictionary.

All fields are optional. Session-level configuration overrides workspace-level configuration, which overrides global configuration.
